intro: Ichnocarpus andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman wild bean, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its seeds are enclosed in hard, woody capsules, which contribute to its classification within the genus Ichnocarpus. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
